intro: Aulostephanus natalensis, commonly known as the Natal stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a unique, clustered arrangement. Aulostephanus natalensis is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
